meanings.sent1: The doctor, a skilled palpator, gently pressed on the patient's abdomen to feel for any abnormalities.
meanings.sent2: The palpator carefully examined the injured athlete's muscles to assess the extent of the damage.
meanings.sent3: The curious palpator couldn't resist checking the texture of the strange fruit at the market.
meanings.sent4: As a palpator of emotions, she could sense the tension in the room without anyone saying a word.
meanings.sent5: The blindfolded palpator relied on touch alone to identify objects placed in front of them.

meanings.sent1: The lump on her arm was palpator, easily detectable by touch.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the swollen glands were palpator and could be felt under the skin.
meanings.sent3: The soft, palpator pillow provided a comfortable place to rest her head.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpator, almost tangible in the air.
meanings.sent5: The palpator sensation of the rough fabric against his skin made him shiver slightly.
